p:
Although <2% of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) infections are reported in the pediatric population, children with comorbidities such as congenital heart disease and those at a younger age are more likely to become critically ill.
1 - 3 Remdesivir has been reported to be efficacious in adults with COVID-19
4 ; however, there are no studies in children. Convalescent plasma (CP) can contain neutralizing antibodies to viruses,
5 and has been used during previous viral epidemics with clinical improvement.
6
- 11 COVID-19 CP (C19-CP) may be useful in critically ill adults, resulting in improvement in inflammatory markers, pulmonary lesions, and mortality.
12 However, the impact of C19-CP in pediatric patients, particularly infants with developing immune systems and significant comorbidities, is completely unknown.
